properties.Name: PolicyAdjustment
properties.Description:
An adjustment to the associated Policy.

For example - a life insurance policy may have the coverage length and amount of accumulated cash values adjusted, premiums may be increased or decreased.    

Adjustments are not retroactive and apply only to the future.

Columns.Name: AdjustmentNumber
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Adjustment.

Columns.Name: InsurancePolicyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Insurance Policy.

Columns.Name: AdjustmentReceivedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Fulfillment was initiated.

Columns.Name: AdjustmentRequestReceivedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Adjustment request was received.

Columns.Name: AdjustmentAuthorizedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Adjustment was authorized for the policy.

Columns.Name: AdjustmentEffectiveDate
Columns.Description: The effective date of the adjustment to the policy.

Columns.Name: AdjustmentAssignedToEmployeeName
Columns.Description: The name of the employee handling the adjustment.

Columns.Name: AdjustmentNote
Columns.Description: Notes, comments or additional information regarding the adjustment.

Columns.Name: AdjustmentCategoryId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Fulfillment Type.

Columns.Name: AdjustmentStatusId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Adjustment Status.

Properties.Description:
An adjustment to the associated Policy.

For example - a life insurance policy may have the coverage length and amount of accumulated cash values adjusted, premiums may be increased or decreased.    

Adjustments are not retroactive and apply only to the future.
